page.title: 16Religion in Gwyddelwern P2
page.content: The{Calvinist Chapel}was formed in 1789 with members meeting in a private house. In 1824 the first{Moria Chapel was built, this was enlarged in 1851 In 1897 the present Moria was errected at a cost of Â£1,250 and the Manse built at a cost of Â£434. A service for adult and a Sunday School are held in Welsh every Sunday. Although small in number ( presently {128)}this chapel has a great influence on the life of the village. There is a Literary Society whose membership is open to anyone and they hold an Annual Eisteddfod in the Village Hall. The Harvest and Christmas Carol Services are bilingual and are held in the Methodist Chapel or St Bueno's Church. funerals are also usually bilingual with all the ministers often joining together. Miss E. Stinson.
